intro: Bracteantha bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored bracteantha, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent characteristics and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with two distinct colors, typically yellow and purple, which attract pollinators. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, aiding in water storage and reducing transpiration. Bracteantha bicolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
